space ch1 3dc in the next chain space continue down the side of the hood and front of the cardigan when you reach the bottom right corner- do the traditional 3dc ch3 3dc in the chain space to form the corner then continue with the ch1 3dc in the next chain space until you reach where you joined 3dc in the last chain space ch3 slip_stitch in the top of starting ch3 to form the corner if satisfied with the length of the cardigan fasten_off otherwise turn and work the pattern back and forth along the bottom of the cardigan like the hood until you reach desired length changing colors when and if necessary then fasten_off closing the hood same concept as closing the back join the yarn at the slip_stitch at the left corner of the hood bring the corners together to work back and forth between the two sides ch3 3dc in the ch4 space of the opposite side of the hood 3dc in the next ch1 space of left side continue to point of hood slip_stitch in the next stitch to flatten down the cluster and fasten_off lengthening the sleeves this part will be worked in rounds join the yarn in the ch3 used to join the sleeve together from earlier r1 ch3 2dc in the same chain space ch1 *3dc in the next chain space ch1* repeat from * to * around slip_stitch in top of beginning ch3 slip_stitch in next 2dc slip_stitch in the chain space r2 repeat row 1 until you reach your desired length slip_stitch in the top of beginning ch3 to close the round last row when you have reached the length you want ch2 counts as 1st half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in every double_crochet and chain space around slip_stitch in top of ch2 to close round fasten_off and weave in end i wanted to try the following to give the sleeve a more closed finish but my daughter wanted to open wide cuff i am going to give
